title: Jesse Harrison Artwork
text:
Biography
I work as a freelance artist with a focus on nature photography, traditional kintsugi / gintsugi repairs and short poems. My art is mostly inspired by my interest in hiking, music and tea.



Photography
My photos are available as Alu-Dibond prints. For quotes, please email me.
Photo awards


2018: Fine Art Photography Awards, Landscape Nominee
2017: MonoVisions, Honourable Mention
2015: Scottish Landscape Photographer of the Year, John Muir Trust Wild Places Prize





Kintsugi / gintsugi repairs
Repairs are available upon request. I only use natural, food-safe raw materials (urushi, tonoko, gold and silver). When requesting a quote, please also send me photos of the broken item(s).



Further details
Aside from art, I work as a Senior Data Scientist and Project Manager at CSC - IT Center for Science. More on this on my other website.

title: New beginnings
text:
It was then I knew the beginning of something new…


For many years, my interests in creating art was strongly focused on landscape photography, often guided through the lends of music. This led me to design several album covers and also music videos. However, more recently I have felt something of a shift in my approach, moving toward and through a wider range of materials and media to work with. The interest in photography remains, but there are also new areas to explore.
That shift also means there was a need for a complete rehaul of my website to create room for new types of content. Spending some time to find a suitable tool for this, I was very happy to discover Quarto. During this process, I also reworked my other professional website using the same template and linked both pages together.
I’ve always preferred lightweight websites and feel this new version does a good job at featuring different kinds of content without sacrificing simplicity. I hope you feel the same and enjoy browsing!

title: Kintsugi & gintsugi repairs
